Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The house is beautiful and tucked away in it's own serene environment. Very, very peaceful. Our visit included 4 adults and 1 child. There was more than enough room for everyone. Each morning brought hundreds of birds singing to us, and squirrels and bunnies were fun to watch to. The pond was also fun for catch and release fishing, and we enjoyed taking a kayak out as well. Fires in the evening at the fire pit added to our enjoyment and contentment. The property really is amazing. In response to other reviews: it is in the country, but an easy ride back to Salem for anything needed. The water does come from a well but the smell did not bother us in the least and there is a water softener installed. The amenities overall were more than we could have asked for and all agree: we highly recommend staying at The Cove. If we could rate it more than 5 stars, we absolutely would.

review_text:
Very clean and comfortable. Property is lovely and would be great in the summer, with a pavilion and fire pit by a pond. Given the local options near Copeland Oaks, I would certainly stay there again.
Two relatively minor notes: The property has well water, which is not an issue, but they desparately need a better filtration system for the sulphur. The hot water especially smelled terrible. I live in a house with well water, so this is not just an issue of city vs. well. They did have filtered water for drinking through the fridge, which as acceptable, but showers in particular were moderately unpleasant.
The accommodations were relatively sparse and could use a couple of extra blankets/throws for cooler months.

rating_info:

,
Â·
September 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Moon is where our love for Kevinâ€™s properties began four years ago, and it's in the same beautiful condition today. It's a beautiful contemporary home tucked in a pocket of old growth hardwood forest with a spectacular view of the ravine behind it. Less than a mile from downtown Salem, the parcel is reminiscent of a state park setting. The Moon sits juxtaposed to its sister, The Stars, and about 30 yards from Dreamcatcher, the newest of the Creekside Cabins. Kevinâ€™s clever building placement and smart design features make it so you barely see the other properties. The interior is stylish, sparkling clean and comfortable. The fully equipped kitchen provides all you need for meal prep on-site. We actually modeled our own bedroom after the bedroom at The Moon. Thatâ€™s how pretty it is. The rain shower head in the bathroom is hard to leave. The hot tub is a welcome newer addition to the property. After your first stay, youâ€™ll be in love with The Moon like we are!

Enjoyed sitting on front porch with coffee/wine enjoying the quiet country surroundings. Kids loved the animals, especially lu lu the pig. Roxanne had a coffee maker set up with great coffee and tea options and tons of dishes and cookware for preparing meals at the house. Very comfortable space with cute country decor. Felt like a home away from home! Reminder to bring your own toiletries (shampoo and soap not provided). Also home is split/divided. Itâ€™s totally separate spaces but it is connected by a wall to the owners home so if you want total privacy this might not be perfect fit. That being said we had no issues with this and Roxanne was very friendly but also let us have our space. Would highly recommend and also return for a repeat stay next time we are in the area visiting family.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Roxanne was a wonderful host. She was very accommodating for us with an early check in and an offer to stay later! She popped in during the afternoon to set our heat for a day that promised to be chillier than May sometimes is. Pretty decorations and a lovely wood bed upstairs for parents with a beautiful quilt. We felt very welcomed as a transracial family with young kids. The kids had a great experience feeling at home during our visit. The kitchen had all we needed to do our meals, and there was plenty of room on comfy couches and a warm rug in the living room for lots of play and even a nap! The kids really loved the slide and walks around the house outside despite the rainy weather. Roxanne was very accommodating to leash her sweet dogs when a couple of our kids felt cautious to meet them, and they had fun saying hi to Jack from the doorway of his dry spot inside the barn. We are planning to return later in the season for any even longer stay and we hope next time they might be brave enough to pet the pig Lulu if she again greets us upon arrival from under the porch! She was a calm friend they talked about for hours and looked for on our walks. A quiet getaway (except for kid play!) we would recommend to any family.

review_text:
This place was perfect! It absolutely exceeded my expectations.
Things that I loved about the place...
there's a garage and a garage door opener remote that they supply you to put in your car. amazing.
the shower!! it was like being in a warm monsoon and I am all about that life.
hot tub was easy to uncover and use.
A GRILL! Made myself some yummy grilled corn one night.
shampoo, conditioner, body wash and lotion are provided.
there is a washer and dryer and they actually supplied soap and dryer sheets. it was so nice.
there are dishes to use as well as a Keurig. powdered creamer was provided. there was also oil and salt and pepper for those who want to cook.
a dishwasher! so wonderful. Soap for the dishwasher was also provided. so lovely.
The only thing about this place that I didn't love is that the walls are INCREDIBLY thin. This past week, my ears have witnessed so many things that I wish they could unhear.
But aside from thin walls...absolute perfection.

Both places have full size refridgerators, dishwashers, microwaves and stoves/ovens. We had lunch for the group at Sabiâ€™s (reserved a room and ate buffet style) and brought the leftovers back to eat later. Later, we warmed up our trays of chicken, pasta, mashed potatoes and carrots in our two ovensâ€¦ateâ€¦cleaned up and went, a short distance, some walked, to enjoy the concert that evening. After the concert, some walked, others rode back in the Model Tâ€™s provided with the reservation to our places and enjoyed marshmellows at the firepit in the courtyard. Everyone had a great time!

review_text:
We had a wonderful time at " The Henry" and the surrounding space. It was very cool and different. We would certainly like to return later in the week or on a weekend with more of the property open for enjoyment including the on premise ill Will Brewery. We had the entire area to ourselves and the only thing missing was some available firewood our first night. We made do with a couple old pallets and some firewood we purchased nearby.
The Town Center looks to be very enjoyable when in full swing and it has a great Mexican Bar and Grill called "Mexico City" and The Burger Joint "Sespe" was fantastic. We also tried frozen yogurt at Orange Leaf which was a very fun place with a number of options to choose from including the frozen yogurt, boba tea and acai bowls.
The accommodations were wonderful and a few times I reached out to Kevin through AirBnB he responded almost immediately. We certainly want to experience a few of his other places that are listed as well.
Highly recommend!

This place is perfect! Everything matches the photos, and the surroundings are beautiful and peaceful. The couch was comfortable enough for some binge watching and the high ceilings make you feel as though you are in a big space, not that the space is small in the first place. Both TVs are equipped with a sound bar which was great for watching TV or listening to your playlist
The linens and bed were so comfortable and there were extra blankets to cuddle with as well.
In the evening, I took advantage of the hot tub, local restaurants, and the Beer/Cigar bar. I highly recommend Sabi's for dinner, Birdfish Brewery for Sunday afternoon on the patio, and the Brewhouae at Firestone Farms.
Excellent stay, looking forward to coming back.

name: Randy And Monica
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
When was the last time you stayed at an Airbnb with its own Model-T for you to cruise the neighborhood in? Kevinâ€™s Columbiana property The Henry and its next-door neighbor The Thomas have changed the game when it comes to experiential stays.
Electric golf carts built to replicate Fordâ€™s famous Model-T are available for guests to drive around the Firestone Farms community, golf course and shops. What a fun and unique investment Kevin has made in his guestsâ€™ experience! We enjoyed an hour-long drive on a sunny autumn afternoon and loved watching the surprised reactions of out-of-towners and the knowing waves of familiar residents as we passed.
Named for Henry Ford and Thomas Edison, the exteriors of these nostalgic properties are replicas of these historic figuresâ€™ boyhood homes. To fully appreciate the homage to Ford and Edison, do a quick internet search for the pairâ€™s annual â€œVagabondsâ€ road trips with Harvey Firestone (a Columbiana native) and the famed naturalist John Burroughs. Or you can read the authoritative book about the troupe that Kevin has provided on the living room table.
Upon entering the house, we were struck by the larger-than-life mural of Henry Ford leaning on the bumper of his history-making automobile. If you stay at enough of Kevinâ€™s properties, youâ€™ll learn that most of them have a similarly breathtaking central wall mural or contemporary furnishing designed and crafted by local artist John Shaw. They are yet another hallmark of Kevinâ€™s unique places.

In contrast to the historically accurate exterior, the interior is anything but dated. High vaulted ceilings, sunlight-ushering windows, a stylish and comfy sofa bed, sleek kitchen cabinets and high-end appliances give the great room a warm and contemporary feel. The bedroom features luxurious linens on a sleep-inducing king bed, a dresser with plenty of drawers to stow your clothes and touch lamps fashioned to resemble period pieces with Edison-style filament light bulbs. Each of the rooms have various lighting options including infinitely dimmable ceiling light fixtures.
The bathroom boasts a black onyx tiled walk-in shower with the most intense rain showerhead my wife and I have ever experienced.
Outside is an expansive red brick patio area with brick inlays in the shape of a Model-T in front of The Henry and a light bulb in front of The Thomas. Brick fire rings provide a great gathering area to enjoy with family or your new friends from next door or the adjacent Ill Will Brewing, where you can enjoy eclectic brews with names like â€œQuestionable Life Choices,â€ â€œToxic Workplaceâ€ and â€œBackhanded Compliment.â€ We personally recommend their "Genoskwa" stout named after the native American term for â€œBigfoot,â€ for which Columbiana is said to be a hotbed for sightings.
Youâ€™ll enjoy unwinding in the relaxing top-of-the-line hot tub after a long day of experiencing The Henry and its surroundings.
As bona fide followers of Kevin Jamison properties, we have been conditioned for increasingly higher expectations with each new offering. The Henry met and exceeded those expectations as anticipated. My wife owns a commercial cleaning business, so it takes on-point cleaning staff and attention to every detail to impress her, which The Henry does with a perfect score.
Kevin is a responsive communicator who is always available for questions, but non-intrusive as he allows his guests to enjoy their stay without interruption.
You canâ€™t go wrong with a stay at The Henry. It will surely lead to return visits. If youâ€™re anything like us, you will find yourself planning stays where Kevinâ€™s homes are the destination and the reason for the trip.

It is beautiful, inviting, light and airy with all the windows and skylights. A warm and cozy gas fire added to the atmosphere of Christmas as well as a wide screen tv with Christmas music and a decorated, lit tree!
The setting was perfect, the front porch and rockers inviting and our visit so peaceful and memorable!
At our request, Aimee suggested wonderful restuaruants, flea markets and thrift shops and things to see. We went to all of them!
The kitchen is very small but adequate as we did not plan to cook. Aimee even left a welcome bag and contacted us each day to see if we had any requests.
This rental is one we will not forget and highly recommend it !

review_text:
My 1st impression when I walked in the door was â€œhow cuteâ€. It would be perfect for a small family or friends gathering. Kitchen was tiny but perfect for our needs. Love the bathroom with the huge walk-in shower. It was extremely hot outside (90 degrees, high humidity) when we stayed, so there was no hanging out on the cute porch or patio. The cabin was plenty cool enough as long as you leave the doors open and let the air circulate. It is a cabin, not a house and the ability to provide an air-conditioned environment to guest is awesome! Aimee has done a great job at providing everything.
Unfortunately, our family included our 2 grandchildren who are 4 years old & 18 months. Not ideal for babies and small children. One bedroom upstairs is an open loft and very comfy and does not have a door, but I liked it! The downstairs bedroom is very small with double size bunkbeds. It was way too hot to close the door or use the top bunk during the scorching summer heat. Our babies missed their bath time; and quiet place to sleep. Totally not Aimeeâ€™s fault, I knew there was no tub. So, with that said, if you love staying in a cabin, near the lake with fishing, swimming, and hiking, come here.

It almost reflected what might have been his laboratory, but with a giant twist toward livability. All rooms were provisioned impeccably; we wanted for nothing. The coffee maker was new to us; it would make a cup or a pot-full equally well. We usually cook many of our meals; the full range of necessities were at our finger tips - all new!! Plenty of light during the day (if desired), but shaded from it in the morning,allowing sleep-inâ€™s as late as desired. The shower was not only huge, but a delight. Plenty of storage, if needed, and plenty of clothes hanging space if multiple functions are on the agenda. The HVAC worked flawlessly for setting a comfortable atmosphere and the jacuzzi was the crowning jewel (wish we had used it more than twice!!!

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We stayed at â€œThe Thomasâ€ for two nights during a trip to explore Columbiana County. This accommodation is spotless, stylish, and beautiful. Self check-in was a breeze using a keypad and the host was very communicative from our initial booking onward. The Thomas is located across the road from Firestone Farms, which is a neat entertainment district with nice restaurants and bars. We hiked in nearby Beaver Creek State Park and enjoyed the local food scene including the wonderful Hoganâ€™s Bakery, Homestead Restaurant, and local craft breweries. In fact, â€œThe Thomasâ€ is located on the same grounds as Ill Will Brewing - a very stylish craft brewery with very good beer. Other fine nearby craft breweries to check out are Birdfish in Columbiana and Numbers in Lisbon. Nearby, The Leetonia Beehive Coke Ovens Park, which is on the National Register of Historic Places is an interesting historic site. Walking through the archaeological remains of this site ( built in 1866) is fascinating and atmospheric. There is also the Liittle Beaver Creek Greenway rails to trails route for cyclists. We live 90 minutes away in Cleveland and the Thomas makes for a splendid weekend getaway both because of the quality of accommodations and the wealth of activities. We will return.

My parents were able to park by the front door and because there isnâ€™t any stairs to climb, they were able to easily access the house. The home has a comfortable queen bed and bathroom located in the first floor. There is a lovely backyard and Jeremy provided extra amenities such as coffee, condiments and snacks. The central air was greatly appreciated during their summer stay. They traveled to my sisterâ€™s home which was only a mile away and spent all day there. They were very comfortable arriving back at the house during the night as the neighborhood is quiet and safe. There is local eatery, Heggyâ€™s right down the road which they enjoyed getting coffee and some candy. This is a great place to stay, and the value is outstanding! So much better than staying in a hotel.
